text: [Music]
quite simply corsera could not exist
without
AWS we rely on AWS every single day to
provide the speed the service the
agility and the scale required to serve
all of our students
[Music]
worldwide my name is Brandon s I'm a
software engineer at corsera corsera is
an educational company we're focused on
connecting the world with top quality
worldclass education we partner with
existing worldclass institutions such as
Stanford Princeton Duke the London
School of Economics the University of
Melbourne in
Australia and we take their top quality
classes and make them available for free
online to anyone who wants to take a
course with aw we've been able to scale
from zero students to 3.2 million
worldwide in one year the entire
experience on cor.org is powered by
Amazon web services through this large
data set that we can capture we can
provide feedback to instructors on how
they're doing on where their courses can
be improved it's only through the
amazing scale and elasticity of Amazon
S3 and Amazon web services that were
able to handle this kind of data so
quickly we would not be able to keep up
with the enormous data growth if we had
to Rack our own servers we use ec2
autoscaling to handle our traffic um
autoscaling and the elasticity of the
Amazon Cloud have been crucial to
keeping corsera up and running we saw a
spike in traffic where over a period of
about 4 minutes we increased the load on
our website by 75% only through
autoscaling and the elasticity of the
Amazon compute Cloud were we able to
handle this traffic Spike gracefully
with no degradation in user service or
experience Amazon web services Global
footprint with Amazon cloudfront have
allowed us to serve our worldwide
audience effectively we serve almost
half a petabyte worth of traffic every
month using Amazon Cloud front we were
able to reduce the static asset loading
time of our front page from 500
milliseconds worldwide down to about 50
milliseconds it took us only two
Engineers about 2 days worth of time and
we had a whole lot of fun doing it we
indexs over 2.5 million documents within
Amazon Cloud search we set it up and
it's been zero touch we haven't had to
maintain it or operate it whatsoever
it's been a great experience over the
past month Amazon RDS has answered over
10 billion SQL queries being able to
click and scale up the size of our RDS
instances in minutes to being able to
scale out the amount of data the RDS
instances are able to to serve has been
a great Boon and allowed us to handle
our scaling needs as we've grown rapid
rapidly over the past year Amazon
redshift has been incredibly easy to
work with we were able to start a
cluster in minutes we've been able to
load data into it and perform test uh
queries and they've all performed
beautifully we hope to use Amazon red
shift to provide deeper insights into
the student learning experience with a
speed and cost- Effectiveness that would
not be possible without Amazon web
services
[Music]
[Applause]
